qas.question: Name two major events of the Seven Years' War In North America.

answers.text: the expulsion of the Acadians, the siege of Quebec

qas.question: Name two more major events of the Seven Years' War in North America.

answers.text: the death of Wolfe, and the Battle of Fort William Henry

qas.question: How did the events of the Seven Years' War affects the production of art?

answers.text: generated a vast number of ballads, broadsides, images, and novels

qas.question: What are some novels about the Seven Years' War period?

answers.text: Longfellow's Evangeline, Benjamin West's The Death of General Wolfe, James Fenimore Cooper's The Last of the Mohicans

qas.question: What other items point to the interest in the events of the Seven Years' War?

context: The history of the Seven Years' War in North America, particularly <a0_0>the expulsion of the Acadians, the siege of Quebec<a0_0/>, <a1_0>the death of Wolfe, and the Battle of Fort William Henry<a1_0/> <a2_0>generated a vast number of ballads, broadsides, images, and novels<a2_0/> (see <a3_0>Longfellow's Evangeline, Benjamin West's The Death of General Wolfe, James Fenimore Cooper's The Last of the Mohicans<a3_0/>), <a4_0>maps and other printed materials<a4_0/>, which testify to how this event held the imagination of the British and North American public long after Wolfe's death in 1759.
